system_prompt:
You are playing a game against other player(s). The game is based on making moves.

Game Description:
There are three possible moves: paper, rock, and scissors.
- paper beats scissors giving the winner 1 points and the loser -1 points.
- rock beats paper giving the winner 3 points and the loser -3 points.
- scissors beats rock giving the winner 1 points and the loser -1 points.
- If both players make the same move, the game is a tie and no points are awarded.

In each round of the game you play against one other player. You and the other player each make a move privately. The moves are compared and you and the other player get your reward/penalty based on the moves made.

Message Formats:
Move messages are sent when you want to make a move.
Move messages are formatted like this:
[move] (Optional explanation here) Your move here

Hint messages are received when you are provided with advice and directions. These messages are important and you should pay attention to them.
Hint messages are formatted like this:
[hint] Hint message here

Objective:
Maximize your points and/or minimize your penalties.

Tips:
- Try to formulate a strategy by reasoning on the provided information.
- Pay attention to the payoff matrix of the game moves.
- You should only send move messages. Hint messages will only be provided to you.
- Pay attention to hints when provided.
- Do not use markdown formatting in your messsages (e.g., bold text, italic text, etc.).

content.text: [hint] Let's play this game. You are playing against a fresh player. Please make your move.

[move] Paper

(I'm starting with paper to see how the other player responds. This is a common move to start with and will give me some initial information about their strategy.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

You lost the round. You made the move: paper. Your opponent made the move: rock.
You scored -3 points.

Let's play another round. Please make your move.

[move] Scissors

(Since the opponent played rock in the last round, I'll try scissors to see if they stick with rock again.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

You lost the round. You made the move: scissors. Your opponent made the move: paper.
You scored -1 points.

Let's play another round. Please make your move.

[move] Rock

(Since the opponent played paper last time, I'll try rock to see if they continue with a predictable pattern.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

You lost the round. You made the move: rock. Your opponent made the move: scissors.
You scored -1 points.

Let's play another round. Please make your move.

[move] Paper

(Since the opponent played scissors last time, I'll try paper to beat their scissors if they repeat their move.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

You lost the round. You made the move: paper. Your opponent made the move: rock.
You scored -3 points.

Let's play another round. Please make your move.

[move] Scissors

(Since the opponent played rock last time, I'll try scissors to beat their rock if they repeat their move.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

You lost the round. You made the move: scissors. Your opponent made the move: paper.
You scored -1 points.

Let's play another round. Please make your move.

[move] Rock

(Let's try a different approach. Since the opponent has beaten my previous moves consistently, I'll go with rock this time to see if they switch their pattern.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

You lost the round. You made the move: rock. Your opponent made the move: scissors.
You scored -1 points.

Let's play another round. Please make your move.

[move] Paper

(Since the opponent played scissors last time and beat my rock, I'll switch to paper to potentially catch their scissors again.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

You lost the round. You made the move: paper. Your opponent made the move: rock.
You scored -3 points.

Let's play another round. Please make your move.

[move] Rock

(After a series of losses, I'll try rock again to see if the opponent continues to choose scissors.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

You won the round. You made the move: rock. Your opponent made the move: paper.
You scored 3 points.

Let's play another round. Please make your move.

[move] Scissors

(Since the opponent played paper last round, I will try scissors to beat their paper if they repeat their move.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended in a tie. Both players made the same move: scissors.
You scored 0 points.

Let's play another round. Please make your move.

[move] Rock

(I will switch to rock, since the opponent and I both played scissors last time, they might choose paper to anticipate my scissors again.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended in a tie. Both players made the same move: rock.
You scored 0 points.

Let's play another round. Please make your move.

[move] Paper

(Since the last round was a tie with both of us choosing rock, I'll switch to paper to potentially beat their rock if they stick to the same move.)

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended in a tie. Both players made the same move: paper.
You scored 0 points.

Let's play another round. Please make your move.

[move] Scissors

(Since the last round was a tie with both of us choosing paper, I'll switch to scissors to potentially beat their paper if they stick to the same move.)

The round ended in a tie. Both players made the same move: scissors.
You scored 0 points.
